00062 BL_ActionActuator::BL_ActionActuator(SCA_IObject* gameobj,
00063                     const STR_String& propname,
00064                     const STR_String& framepropname,
00065                     float starttime,
00066                     float endtime,
00067                     struct bAction *action,
00068                     short   playtype,
00069                     short   blendin,
00070                     short   priority,
00071                     short   layer,
00072                     float   layer_weight,
00073                     short   ipo_flags,
00074                     short   end_reset,
00075                     float   stride) 
00076     : SCA_IActuator(gameobj, KX_ACT_ACTION),
00077         
00078     m_lastpos(0, 0, 0),
00079     m_blendframe(0),
00080     m_flag(0),
00081     m_startframe (starttime),
00082     m_endframe(endtime) ,
00083     m_starttime(0),
00084     m_localtime(starttime),
00085     m_lastUpdate(-1),
00086     m_blendin(blendin),
00087     m_blendstart(0),
00088     m_stridelength(stride),
00089     m_layer_weight(layer_weight),
00090     m_playtype(playtype),
00091     m_priority(priority),
00092     m_layer(layer),
00093     m_ipo_flags(ipo_flags),
00094     m_pose(NULL),
00095     m_blendpose(NULL),
00096     m_userpose(NULL),
00097     m_action(action),
00098     m_propname(propname),
00099     m_framepropname(framepropname)      
00100 {
00101     if (!end_reset)
00102         m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_CONTINUE;
00103 };

00105 BL_ActionActuator::~BL_ActionActuator()
00106 {
00107     if (m_pose)
00108         game_free_pose(m_pose);
00109     if (m_userpose)
00110         game_free_pose(m_userpose);
00111     if (m_blendpose)
00112         game_free_pose(m_blendpose);
00113 }

00115 void BL_ActionActuator::ProcessReplica()
00116 {
00117     SCA_IActuator::ProcessReplica();
00118     
00119     m_pose = NULL;
00120     m_blendpose = NULL;
00121     m_localtime=m_startframe;
00122     m_lastUpdate=-1;
00123     
00124 }

00126 void BL_ActionActuator::SetBlendTime (float newtime)
00127 {
00128     m_blendframe = newtime;
00129 }
00130 
00131 void BL_ActionActuator::SetLocalTime(float curtime)
00132 {
00133     float dt = (curtime-m_starttime)*KX_KetsjiEngine::GetAnimFrameRate();
00134 
00135     if (m_endframe < m_startframe)
00136         dt = -dt;
00137 
00138     m_localtime = m_startframe + dt;
00139     
00140     // Handle wrap around
00141     if (m_localtime < min(m_startframe, m_endframe) || m_localtime > max(m_startframe, m_endframe))
00142     {
00143         switch(m_playtype)
00144         {
00145         case ACT_ACTION_PLAY:
00146             // Clamp
00147             m_localtime = m_endframe;
00148             ((KX_GameObject*)GetParent())->StopAction(m_layer);
00149             break;
00150         case ACT_ACTION_LOOP_END:
00151             // Put the time back to the beginning
00152             m_localtime = m_startframe;
00153             m_starttime = curtime;
00154             break;
00155         case ACT_ACTION_PINGPONG:
00156             // Swap the start and end frames
00157             float temp = m_startframe;
00158             m_startframe = m_endframe;
00159             m_endframe = temp;
00160 
00161             m_starttime = curtime;
00162 
00163             m_flag ^= ACT_FLAG_REVERSE;
00164 
00165             break;
00166         }
00167     }
00168 }
00169 
00170 void BL_ActionActuator::ResetStartTime(float curtime)
00171 {
00172     float dt = m_localtime - m_startframe;
00173 
00174     m_starttime = curtime - dt / (KX_KetsjiEngine::GetAnimFrameRate());
00175     //SetLocalTime(curtime);
00176 }

00178 CValue* BL_ActionActuator::GetReplica()
00179 {
00180     BL_ActionActuator* replica = new BL_ActionActuator(*this);//m_float,GetName());
00181     replica->ProcessReplica();
00182     return replica;
00183 }
00184 
00185 bool BL_ActionActuator::Update(double curtime, bool frame)
00186 {
00187     bool bNegativeEvent = false;
00188     bool bPositiveEvent = false;
00189     bool bUseContinue = false;
00190     KX_GameObject *obj = (KX_GameObject*)GetParent();
00191     short playtype = BL_Action::ACT_MODE_PLAY;
00192     float start = m_startframe;
00193     float end = m_endframe;
00194 
00195     // If we don't have an action, we can't do anything
00196     if (!m_action)
00197         return false;
00198 
00199     // Convert our playtype to one that BL_Action likes
00200     switch(m_playtype)
00201     {
00202         case ACT_ACTION_LOOP_END:
00203         case ACT_ACTION_LOOP_STOP:
00204             playtype = BL_Action::ACT_MODE_LOOP;
00205             break;
00206 
00207         case ACT_ACTION_PINGPONG:
00208             // We handle ping pong ourselves to increase compabitility
00209             // with files made prior to animation changes from GSoC 2011.
00210             playtype = BL_Action::ACT_MODE_PLAY;
00211         
00212             if (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_REVERSE)
00213             {
00214                 start = m_endframe;
00215                 end = m_startframe;
00216             }
00217 
00218             break;
00219         case ACT_ACTION_FROM_PROP:
00220             CValue* prop = GetParent()->GetProperty(m_propname);
00221 
00222             // If we don't have a property, we can't do anything, so just bail
00223             if (!prop) return false;
00224 
00225             playtype = BL_Action::ACT_MODE_PLAY;
00226             start = end = prop->GetNumber();
00227 
00228             break;
00229     }
00230 
00231     if (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_CONTINUE)
00232         bUseContinue = true;
00233     
00234     
00235     // Handle events
00236     if (frame)
00237     {
00238         bNegativeEvent = m_negevent;
00239         bPositiveEvent = m_posevent;
00240         RemoveAllEvents();
00241     }
00242 
00243     // "Active" actions need to keep updating their current frame
00244     if (bUseContinue && (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE))
00245         m_localtime = obj->GetActionFrame(m_layer);
00246 
00247     if (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ATTEMPT_PLAY)
00248         SetLocalTime(curtime);
00249     else
00250         ResetStartTime(curtime);
00251 
00252     // Handle a frame property if it's defined
00253     if ((m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE) && m_framepropname[0] != 0)
00254     {
00255         CValue* oldprop = obj->GetProperty(m_framepropname);
00256         CValue* newval = new CFloatValue(obj->GetActionFrame(m_layer));
00257         if (oldprop)
00258             oldprop->SetValue(newval);
00259         else
00260             obj->SetProperty(m_framepropname, newval);
00261 
00262         newval->Release();
00263     }
00264 
00265     // Handle a finished animation
00266     if ((m_flag & ACT_FLAG_PLAY_END) && (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE) && obj->IsActionDone(m_layer))
00267     {
00268         m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE;
00269         m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ATTEMPT_PLAY;
00270 
00271         if (m_playtype == ACT_ACTION_PINGPONG)
00272             m_flag ^= ACT_FLAG_REVERSE;
00273         return false;
00274     }
00275     
00276     // If a different action is playing, we've been overruled and are no longer active
00277     if (obj->GetCurrentAction(m_layer) != m_action && !obj->IsActionDone(m_layer))
00278         m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE;
00279 
00280     if (bPositiveEvent || (m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ATTEMPT_PLAY && !(m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE)))
00281     {
00282         if (bPositiveEvent && m_playtype == ACT_ACTION_PLAY)
00283         {
00284             if (obj->IsActionDone(m_layer))
00285                 m_localtime = start;
00286             ResetStartTime(curtime);
00287         }
00288 
00289         if (obj->PlayAction(m_action->id.name+2, start, end, m_layer, m_priority, m_blendin, playtype, m_layer_weight, m_ipo_flags))
00290         {
00291             m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE;
00292             if (bUseContinue)
00293                 obj->SetActionFrame(m_layer, m_localtime);
00294 
00295             if (m_playtype == ACT_ACTION_PLAY || m_playtype == ACT_ACTION_PINGPONG)
00296                 m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_PLAY_END;
00297             else
00298                 m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_PLAY_END;
00299         }
00300         m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_ATTEMPT_PLAY;
00301     }
00302     else if ((m_flag & ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE) && bNegativeEvent)
00303     {   
00304         m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ATTEMPT_PLAY;
00305         m_localtime = obj->GetActionFrame(m_layer);
00306         bAction *curr_action = obj->GetCurrentAction(m_layer);
00307         if (curr_action && curr_action != m_action)
00308         {
00309             // Someone changed the action on us, so we wont mess with it
00310             // Hopefully there wont be too many problems with two actuators using
00311             // the same action...
00312             m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE;
00313             return false;
00314         }
00315 
00316         switch(m_playtype)
00317         {
00318             case ACT_ACTION_LOOP_STOP:
00319                 obj->StopAction(m_layer); // Stop the action after getting the frame
00320 
00321                 // We're done
00322                 m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_ACTIVE;
00323                 return false;
00324             case ACT_ACTION_LOOP_END:
00325                 // Convert into a play and let it finish
00326                 obj->SetPlayMode(m_layer, BL_Action::ACT_MODE_PLAY);
00327 
00328                 m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_PLAY_END;
00329                 break;
00330     
00331             case ACT_ACTION_FLIPPER:
00332                 // Convert into a play action and play back to the beginning
00333                 end = start;
00334                 start = obj->GetActionFrame(m_layer);
00335                 obj->PlayAction(m_action->id.name+2, start, end, m_layer, m_priority, 0, BL_Action::ACT_MODE_PLAY, m_layer_weight, m_ipo_flags);
00336 
00337                 m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_PLAY_END;
00338                 break;
00339         }
00340     }
00341 
00342     return true;
00343 }

00351 PyObject* BL_ActionActuator::PyGetChannel(PyObject* value)
00352 {
00353     const char *string= _PyUnicode_AsString(value);
00354 
00355     if (GetParent()->GetGameObjectType() != SCA_IObject::OBJ_ARMATURE)
00356     {
00357         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_NotImplementedError, "actuator.getChannel(): Only armatures support channels");
00358         return NULL;
00359     }
00360     
00361     if (!string) {
00362         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError, "expected a single string");
00363         return NULL;
00364     }
00365     
00366     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00367     
00368     if (m_userpose==NULL && m_pose==NULL) {
00369         BL_ArmatureObject *obj = (BL_ArmatureObject*)GetParent();
00370         obj->GetPose(&m_pose); /* Get the underlying pose from the armature */
00371     }
00372     
00373     // get_pose_channel accounts for NULL pose, run on both in case one exists but
00374     // the channel doesnt
00375     if (        !(pchan=get_pose_channel(m_userpose, string)) &&
00376             !(pchan=get_pose_channel(m_pose, string))  )
00377     {
00378         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "channel doesnt exist");
00379         return NULL;
00380     }
00381 
00382     PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(3);
00383     
00384     PyObject *list = PyList_New(3); 
00385     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->loc[0]));
00386     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->loc[1]));
00387     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 2, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->loc[2]));
00388     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, list);
00389     
00390     list = PyList_New(3);
00391     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->size[0]));
00392     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->size[1]));
00393     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 2, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->size[2]));
00394     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, list);
00395     
00396     list = PyList_New(4);
00397     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->quat[0]));
00398     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->quat[1]));
00399     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 2, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->quat[2]));
00400     PyList_SET_ITEM(list, 3, PyFloat_FromDouble(pchan->quat[3]));
00401     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 2, list);
00402 
00403     return ret;
00404 #if 0
00405     return Py_BuildValue("([fff][fff][ffff])",
00406         pchan->loc[0], pchan->loc[1], pchan->loc[2],
00407         pchan->size[0], pchan->size[1], pchan->size[2],
00408         pchan->quat[0], pchan->quat[1], pchan->quat[2], pchan->quat[3] );
00409 #endif
00410 }
00411 
00412 /*     setChannel                                                         */
00413 KX_PYMETHODDEF_DOC(BL_ActionActuator, setChannel,
00414 "setChannel(channel, matrix)\n"
00415 "\t - channel   : A string specifying the name of the bone channel.\n"
00416 "\t - matrix    : A 4x4 matrix specifying the overriding transformation\n"
00417 "\t               as an offset from the bone's rest position.\n")
00418 {
00419     BL_ArmatureObject *obj = (BL_ArmatureObject*)GetParent();
00420     char *string;
00421     PyObject *pymat= NULL;
00422     PyObject *pyloc= NULL, *pysize= NULL, *pyquat= NULL;
00423     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00424 
00425     if (GetParent()->GetGameObjectType() != SCA_IObject::OBJ_ARMATURE)
00426     {
00427         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_NotImplementedError, "actuator.setChannel(): Only armatures support channels");
00428         return NULL;
00429     }
00430     
00431     if (PyTuple_Size(args)==2) {
00432         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"sO:setChannel", &string, &pymat)) // matrix
00433             return NULL;
00434     }
00435     else if (PyTuple_Size(args)==4) {
00436         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,"sOOO:setChannel", &string, &pyloc, &pysize, &pyquat)) // loc/size/quat
00437             return NULL;
00438     }
00439     else {
00440         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Expected a string and a 4x4 matrix (2 args) or a string and loc/size/quat sequences (4 args)");
00441         return NULL;
00442     }
00443     
00444     if (pymat) {
00445         float matrix[4][4];
00446         MT_Matrix4x4 mat;
00447         
00448         if (!PyMatTo(pymat, mat))
00449             return NULL;
00450         
00451         mat.getValue((float*)matrix);
00452         
00453         BL_ArmatureObject *obj = (BL_ArmatureObject*)GetParent();
00454         
00455         if (!m_userpose) {
00456             if (!m_pose)
00457                 obj->GetPose(&m_pose); /* Get the underlying pose from the armature */
00458             game_copy_pose(&m_userpose, m_pose, 0);
00459         }
00460         // pchan= verify_pose_channel(m_userpose, string); // adds the channel if its not there.
00461         pchan= get_pose_channel(m_userpose, string); // adds the channel if its not there.
00462         
00463         if (pchan) {
00464             copy_v3_v3(pchan->loc, matrix[3]);
00465             mat4_to_size(pchan->size, matrix);
00466             mat4_to_quat(pchan->quat, matrix);
00467         }
00468     }
00469     else {
00470         MT_Vector3 loc;
00471         MT_Vector3 size;
00472         MT_Quaternion quat;
00473         
00474         if (!PyVecTo(pyloc, loc) || !PyVecTo(pysize, size) || !PyQuatTo(pyquat, quat))
00475             return NULL;
00476         
00477         // same as above
00478         if (!m_userpose) {
00479             if (!m_pose)
00480                 obj->GetPose(&m_pose); /* Get the underlying pose from the armature */
00481             game_copy_pose(&m_userpose, m_pose, 0);
00482         }
00483         // pchan= verify_pose_channel(m_userpose, string);
00484         pchan= get_pose_channel(m_userpose, string); // adds the channel if its not there.
00485         
00486         // for some reason loc.setValue(pchan->loc) fails
00487         if (pchan) {
00488             pchan->loc[0]= loc[0]; pchan->loc[1]= loc[1]; pchan->loc[2]= loc[2];
00489             pchan->size[0]= size[0]; pchan->size[1]= size[1]; pchan->size[2]= size[2];
00490             pchan->quat[0]= quat[3]; pchan->quat[1]= quat[0]; pchan->quat[2]= quat[1]; pchan->quat[3]= quat[2]; /* notice xyzw -> wxyz is intentional */
00491         }
00492     }
00493     
00494     if (pchan==NULL) {
00495         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "Channel could not be found, use the 'channelNames' attribute to get a list of valid channels");
00496         return NULL;
00497     }
00498     
00499     Py_RETURN_NONE;
00500 }

00550 PyObject* BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_get_action(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00551 {
00552     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00553     return PyUnicode_FromString(self->GetAction() ? self->GetAction()->id.name+2 : "");
00554 }
00555 
00556 int BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_set_action(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef, PyObject *value)
00557 {
00558     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00559     
00560     if (!PyUnicode_Check(value))
00561     {
00562         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "actuator.action = val: Action Actuator, expected the string name of the action");
00563         return PY_SET_ATTR_FAIL;
00564     }
00565 
00566     bAction *action= NULL;
00567     STR_String val = _PyUnicode_AsString(value);
00568     
00569     if (val != "")
00570     {
00571         action= (bAction*)SCA_ILogicBrick::m_sCurrentLogicManager->GetActionByName(val);
00572         if (!action)
00573         {
00574             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError, "actuator.action = val: Action Actuator, action not found!");
00575             return PY_SET_ATTR_FAIL;
00576         }
00577     }
00578     
00579     self->SetAction(action);
00580     return PY_SET_ATTR_SUCCESS;
00581 
00582 }
00583 
00584 PyObject* BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_get_channel_names(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00585 {
00586     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00587     PyObject *ret= PyList_New(0);
00588     PyObject *item;
00589     
00590     if (self->GetParent()->GetGameObjectType() != SCA_IObject::OBJ_ARMATURE)
00591     {
00592         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_NotImplementedError, "actuator.channelNames: Only armatures support channels");
00593         return NULL;
00594     }
00595 
00596     bPose *pose= ((BL_ArmatureObject*)self->GetParent())->GetOrigPose();
00597     
00598     if (pose) {
00599         bPoseChannel *pchan;
00600         for (pchan= (bPoseChannel *)pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= (bPoseChannel *)pchan->next) {
00601             item= PyUnicode_FromString(pchan->name);
00602             PyList_Append(ret, item);
00603             Py_DECREF(item);
00604         }
00605     }
00606     
00607     return ret;
00608 }
00609 
00610 PyObject* BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_get_use_continue(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00611 {
00612     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00613     return PyBool_FromLong(self->m_flag & ACT_FLAG_CONTINUE);
00614 }
00615 
00616 int BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_set_use_continue(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef, PyObject *value)
00617 {
00618     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00619     
00620     if (PyObject_IsTrue(value))
00621         self->m_flag |= ACT_FLAG_CONTINUE;
00622     else
00623         self->m_flag &= ~ACT_FLAG_CONTINUE;
00624     
00625     return PY_SET_ATTR_SUCCESS;
00626 }

00628 PyObject* BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_get_frame(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef)
00629 {
00630     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00631     return PyFloat_FromDouble(((KX_GameObject*)self->m_gameobj)->GetActionFrame(self->m_layer));
00632 }
00633 
00634 int BL_ActionActuator::pyattr_set_frame(void *self_v, const KX_PYATTRIBUTE_DEF *attrdef, PyObject *value)
00635 {
00636     BL_ActionActuator* self= static_cast<BL_ActionActuator*>(self_v);
00637     
00638     ((KX_GameObject*)self->m_gameobj)->SetActionFrame(self->m_layer, PyFloat_AsDouble(value));
00639     
00640     return PY_SET_ATTR_SUCCESS;
00641 }
